oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Restless Heart Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Restless Heart (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Restless Heart; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) "Fast Movin' Train" is joked about by Larry Stewart, Paul Gregg, Greg Jennings and John Dittrich -- (00:33) Dittrich describes the competition to get "Fast Movin' Train" from its writer Dave Loggins -- (00:57) Stewart introduces "Dancy's Dream" writer Jennings, and Restless Heart members joke about casting the movie Angel Heart -- (02:02) Dittrich tells a story about how the Oklahoma Mafia became Restless Heart and the Restless Heart members joke about Alabama -- (03:33) "Sweet Auburn" is told by Stewart as a tribute to the various connections he has to Auburn in his life -- (04:20) "I've Never Been So Sure" is introduced by Biff Collie and Stewart pokes fun at Dave Innis -- (04:40) "I've Never Been So Sure" is joked about by Gregg and Stewart based on its ability to make people dance -- (04:57) "Long Lost Friend" is joked about as a connection to Auburn and dancing -- (05:31) Stewart reflects on "Long Lost Friend" as a track that was incomplete until Jennings' guitar ballad -- (06:00) Collie questions the accolades of the group and Stewart discusses the nominations Restless Heart has obtained -- (06:47) "A Little More Coal on the Fire" is described as a 'spunky' song -- (07:15) Jennings and Dittrich reflect on the number of albums they have released and they, along with Collie, discuss having one of the few country music videos -- (07:55) Jennings discusses the Restless Heart radio contest with Dittrich, Gregg and Collie -- (09:22) Collie and Restless Heart joke about Gregg being a cook and winning an evening with Jennings -- (09:42) "When Somebody Loves You" is described as a feeling -- (10:13) Collie and the Restless Heart members joke about the best stories from the road; Dittrich tells a story of his greatest embarrassment -- (12:03) Stewart tells of a time he fell three times in a single performance and the other members of Restless Heart recall their reactions -- (13:21) Dittrich describes the inspiration to "Lady Luck" being a trip to Las Vegas -- (14:21) Dittrich recalls watching Rain Man and seeing the machine he had played on -- (15:11) Gregg and Collie discuss a scene where Restless Heart were in New York and the members of Restless Heart describe the 'wild' evening -- (16:28) Collie and Restless Heart discuss their time on the Tonight Show and Dittrich reviles the Tonight Show's drummer was once his teacher -- (17:50) "River of Stone" is described as a track about leaving one's hometown in search of meaning -- (18:42) Collie discusses with each of Restless Heart members about their childhood aspirations -- (20:41) Stewart reveals the various jobs each member of Restless Heart had performed, and Dittrich reflects on the conditions how Restless Heart had come together -- (21:44) The Restless Heart members say goodbye and hello -- (21:55) Restless Heart greeting radio spot
